uk.ac.gla.terrier.utility
Class TagCodes

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.gla.terrier.utility.TagCodes
public class TagCodes
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used for assigning codes to tags as we index a document collection.

It makes use of two properties from the default properties file. The first one is termcodes.initialcapacity, which specifies the initial capacity of the used hash map. The default value is 3000000.

The second property is termcodes.garbagecollect, which enables or disables garbage collection during the call of the method reset(). The default value is true.

Version:
$Revision: 1.1 $
Author:
Vassilis Plachouras

Constructor Detail

TagCodes

public TagCodes()
Method Detail

initialise

public static void initialise()
Initialises the properties from the property file. The initial capacity of the hash map, is set to the value of the property tagcodes.initialcapacity. The default value is 3000000. The second property is related to the method reset() and enables or disables garbage collection when the reset method is called. The corresponding property is tagcodes.garbagecollect, and its default property is true.

getCode

public static int getCode(java.lang.String tag)
Returns the code for a given tag.

Parameters:
tag - String the tag for which the code will be returned.
Returns:
int the code for the given tag

assignCode

public static int assignCode(java.lang.String tag1,
                             java.lang.String tag2)
Assigns a code of one tag to another tag After this call tag2 will have the same code as tag1

Parameters:
tag1 - the first tag
tag2 - the second tag
Returns:
the assigned code.

hasCode

public static boolean hasCode(java.lang.String tag)
Check whether already a code exists for this tag

Parameters:
tag - The tag to check
Returns:

reset

public static void reset()
Resets the hashmap that contains the mapping from the tags to the tag ids. If the property garbageCollection is true, then it performs garbage collection in order to free alocated memory. This method should be called after the creation of the lexicon.
